description.plain:
“Eugene” details an unrequited love for a straight girl who is in a relationship with a man named Eugene. In a tweet Parks explained that the song was inspired by a poem she wrote ‘at 3am on the night bus’:
https://pbs.twimg.com/media/EQres74WsAA6I_O?format=jpg&name=medium

The music video was directed by the Coyle Larner brothers. Parks described the experience in a press release:

I was so grateful to be able to work with the Coyle-Larner brothers. They created such an intimate visual that really allows for a million different interpretations – it was a very special moment for me.

body.plain:
“Eugene” details an unrequited love for a straight girl who is in a relationship with a man named Eugene. In a tweet Parks explained that the song was inspired by a poem she wrote ‘at 3am on the night bus’:
https://pbs.twimg.com/media/EQres74WsAA6I_O?format=jpg&name=medium

The music video was directed by the Coyle Larner brothers. Parks described the experience in a press release:

I was so grateful to be able to work with the Coyle-Larner brothers. They created such an intimate visual that really allows for a million different interpretations – it was a very special moment for me.

songs.full_title: Arlo Parks - Eugene (Traducción al Español) by Genius Traducciones al Español
songs.title: Arlo Parks - Eugene (Traducción al Español)

annotations:
Hey, I know I’ve been a little bit off and that’s my mistake
 I kind of fell half in love and you’re to blame
 I guess I just forgot that we’ve been mates since day
 Yeah, I don’t know what to say
 Hey, I know I’ve been a little bit off and that’s my mistake
 I kind of fell half in love and you’re to blame
 I guess I just forgot that we’ve been mates since day
 Yeah, I don’t know what to say

The chorus serves as the ground for many of the complex themes of the song to collide.

In a 2020 interview for DIY, Arlo stated that (the song) “explores the agony, jealousy and confusion that comes to light when the lines between platonic and romantic love blur.”

Oh, when I see you smile with your teeth at Eugene
 Yeah, I can’t deal

Arlo knows Eugene makes her friend genuinely happy – this isn’t a short – time thing or a poor decision which will lead to her friend running back to her. Knowing someone else is providing her with what Arlo wishes she could naturally causes overwhelming jealousy.
I hold your head back when you’re too lean
An intimate act showing how close they are – Arlo is trusted to watch over her friend whilst heavily intoxicated and helps with no complaints whilst her friend is ill.
I hold the Taco Bell and you cried over Eugene
Again highlighting the supportive highlight of their friendship – Arlo is there with food and comfort every time her friend fights or breaks up with Eugene.

He was mean
 He was mean

The repetition could mean several things – mostly it sounds reminiscent of a repetitive, calming chant. Arlo reassures her friend that Eugene was in the wrong – it’s his fault, he’s to blame. This highlights the supportive nature of their friendship.

However, it could also be interpreted as self reassurance on Arlo’s part – she’s telling herself Eugene was a bad match, hoping her friend won’t return to her relationship with him, in order to avoid feeling left out or mistreated by her friend again.

You know I like you like that
 I hate that son of a bitch

These lines are ironic – Arlo is aware that her friend is perhaps being insensitive by not addressing her feelings, but misplaces this anger on the object of her jealousy. It shows how people will try to avoid making the people they love out to be villains by blaming others or even themselves, because we refuse to believe the ones we love would ever purposely or willfully mistreat us.
I thought that that was our thing

This line highlights Arlo’s jealousy which leads to possessiveness – obviously this music and poetry isn’t unique to Arlo and her friend’s relationship, yet it feels cheapened when it’s shared with someone outside of that bond. It removes the intimacy, the time and effort that went into sharing and developing a mutual interest in those things.
Read him Sylvia Plath

Sylvia Plath was known for being a feminist poet whose work heavily featured around her depression. Her work often resonates with young girls struggling with similar issues. Again, reading poetry with someone is quite an intimate act as it requires being emotionally vulnerable enough to share personal interpretations of the work. It’s also quite an intellectual activity to partake it, especially considering the complexity of a lot of Plath’s work, suggesting Arlo and her friend are both personally and intellectually matched.
You play him records I showed you

Sharing music with someone is often a very personal, intimate act as you share songs that either remind you of the other person or that you’d think they’d enjoy – either way demonstrating a high amount of knowledge and care about the person you’re sharing the music with. By this girl passing the music on, it undermines the nature of the act and Arlo’s feelings towards her.

The underpart of your eyes was violet
 You hung a cigarette between your purple lips

The use of color – amethyst, violet, and purple, is important. Both these lines and the amethyst line use the color purple to symbolize a lesbian relationship. Purple, such as lavender and violet, has been a part of the lesbian community for a very long time (see Sappho’s use of violets in her poetry and the Lavender Menace group). Being in love with your best friend is a big part of the LGBTQIA+ experience, particular the lesbian and wlw experience. The context of the colors Arlo uses lets us know in the first verse what the song is about without her having to explicitly say the song is gay.

Another meaning of her eyes being discolored could be that it shows how this girl is tired and unhealthy. These two lines serve to highlight the imperfections of this girl, but also her youth – exhaustion, smoking and heavier, darker makeup is often associated with late teens / young adults.

The color purple is also associated with royalty and rarity, showing how Arlo views this person highly – a one in a million type person.

songs.title: Cola (lo fi lounge)

annotations: Bacardi
An expensive white rum. The guy portrayed has a quick temper, adding to the abusive, portraying image we are given of him.
Grapes

Further reference to purple, contained in the objects surrounding the offending character.

A theme of the colour purple runs throughout the song – representing arrogance, vanity and selfishness in person betraying the narrator in this song. Arlo builds up a poetic underlying image that makes the song vivid and painful.
The one that makes you look like Gerard Way

Parks is referencing the singer from pop punk band My Chemical Romance.
This fits with the following description, as Way is known for his punk style.

Leave me to my own devices
 It’s better when your coca-cola eyes are out of my face
 I checked your phone and no surprises
 She’s grinning from ear to ear in purple lace

This verse implies that the narrator of the song suspected her significant other of cheating, and upon checking their phone, found lewd photos from another woman.

A theme of the colour purple runs throughout the song – representing arrogance, vanity and selfishness in person betraying the narrator in this song. Arlo builds up a poetic underlying image that makes the song vivid and painful.
So take your orchids

On Soundcloud, Parks wrote:

Cola is a reminder that betrayal is inevitable when it comes to pretty people that think flowers fix everything.

It appears that her ex tried to win her back with orchids, a deep purple, expensive type of flower.

This lyric continues with the motif of the colour purple throughout the song – representing arrogance, vanity and selfishness in person betraying the narrator in this song. Arlo builds up a poetic underlying image that makes the song vivid and painful.

songs.full_title: Too Good (Unknown Mortal Orchestra Remix) by Arlo Parks
songs.title: Too Good (Unknown Mortal Orchestra Remix)

annotations: Never use your words to show you care

In an interview with Coup de Main, Arlo Parks shared her thoughts on why communication can be so difficult, especially in relationships:

I think true communication comes down to honesty and honesty is hard. Vulnerability, healthily vocalising concerns or hurt, saying “I love you,” saying “that hurt me,” these are all very hard things to do because it’s almost like showing a weak point in your armour. The best friendships and relationships I’ve had are ones where both parties have a degree of transparency with each other and there’s a distinct lack of judgement – you both feel safe enough to bare your soul a little bit.

You’re too proud to tell me that you care
 Watching you tryna push away
 It hurts when you see it coming

Even though she knows how they feel towards her, Arlo wishes they showed more affection with their words and were more vocal with the way they felt. This leads to Arlo craving more warmth from her partner whilst they keep a colder attitude.

With Arlo’s significant other being described as “too proud” and reluctant to show affection, we can infer that this person has been hurt in previous relationships for showing vulnerability. This explains why they would come off as cold or uncaring towards Arlo.

Arlo understands that this is a trend in her relationship, yet endures it since she seems very invested in this relationship. So in the lines, “it hurts when you see it coming,” Arlo recognizes this pattern and feels the pain in knowing what has yet to occur.
Babe you’re so good, you’re too good to be true

When Arlo says “you’re too good to be true,” she is referring to the facade of her significant other. With this in mind, we can infer that she is only seeing the things that they want her to see, leading to this “too good to be true” perspective.
Why’d we make the simplest things so hard?

In an interview with Coup de Main, Arlo Parks shared her thoughts on this question, and how she began to come to terms with it:

I think it’s still something that I haven’t quite figured out. It’s part of human nature to overcomplicate, overthink, and overanalyze things I think, but I’ve definitely grown up a fair bit since the time I was writing about. I think at the time I wanted romantic feelings to be warm and simple when in reality there are so many facets and knots when it comes to love – acknowledging that was definitely an important step.
You quote Thom Yorke
Thom Yorke is the frontman for British Alternative band Radiohead

songs.full_title: Black Dog (Apple Music At Home With Session) by Arlo Parks
songs.title: Black Dog (Apple Music At Home With Session)
songs.title_with_featured: Black Dog (Apple Music At Home With Session)

annotations: I’d take a jump off the fire escape

while arlo sought to heal her friend with her love in the first verse, she has now grown more desperate. she is willing to rid her friend of her depression by any means necessary, even putting herself at risk in the process. once more, arlo wishes she was the one in pain instead of her friend.
I’d lick the grief right off your lips

arlo establishes her desire to rid her friend of her depression, wishing she could heal her with her love (which is illustrated by the intimate gesture of licking her lips).

the choice of the word “lick” is crucial, as it implies arlo would go as far as ’ingesting’ her friend’s grief to save her from her depression. arlo would rather be the one in pain instead of her friend.

I know that you are trying
 But that’s what makes it terrifying

Arlo is scared because she knows her friend is trying to get better yet nothing seems to work, her friend is not getting better.

The scary part is wondering how bad things could be if they did stop trying.
You do your eyes like

Robert Smith famously wears dark eyeshadow, creating a dark, gothic look, which is often associated with depression. The subject may be doing this as they feel it fitting to how they feel on the inside.
It’s so cruel what your mind can do for no reason

This is referring to the subjects depression. As having depression is not a choice nor the fault of the sufferer, and in this case, may not be triggered by anything in particular, their mind is putting them through this ‘cruel’ experience for ‘no reason’ and this is not fair on the sufferer as they don’t deserve it.

Sometimes it seems like you won’t survive this
 And honestly it’s terrifying
Parks is terrified that she’ll lose her friend to suicide.
Just take your medicine
This is presumably a reference to anti-depressant drugs, medication to combat depression.
I would do anything to get you out your room
A common trait of depression is not having the energy to do anything, let alone leave your room. Arlo Parks is singing about how she wants to help her friend who is struggling with depression.
To make the black dog go away
‘Black dog’ is a term coined by the writer Samuel Jackson and later popularised by Winston Churchill referring to depression and depressive disorders.
Robert Smith
Robert Smith is the lead singer of the British band The Cure.

album.full_title: Collapsed in Sunbeams (Deluxe) by Arlo Parks
album.name: Collapsed in Sunbeams (Deluxe)

songs.full_title: Hurt (lo fi lounge) by Arlo Parks
songs.title: Hurt (lo fi lounge)

annotations: Heart so soft it hurt to beat

This is likely a reference to Parks' poem, “Eugene”. Although the poem mostly went on to inspire the titular song, this does also paraphrase a line from the poem:

And what a heart! So soft, sometimes it hurt to beat.



An excerpt from “Eugene”

Charlie started seeing stars
 So stuck on the new Jai Paul
 Said, ”My clothes are sticking to me
 And I can’t quite see my walls”
 Started dreaming of a house
 With red carnations by the windows
 Where he didn’t feel so small
 So overwhelmed by all his flaws
This part of the song is spoken word poetry written by Arlo, she is known post her poetry regularly on social media and hopes to soon release a book of poetry herself.

search_results.title: Hope
search_results.lyrics:
Hope Lyrics[Verse 1]
Millie tried to talk the pleasure back into being alive
Reminiscing 'bout the apricots and blunts on Peckham Rye
Won't call her friends 'cause she's ashamed of being locked into bed
Can't feel her legs and feeling like a liar at best

[Chorus]
You're not alone like you think you are
You're not alone like you think you are
We all have scars, I know it's hard
You're not alone, you're not alone
You're not alone like you think you are
You're not alonе like you think you are
We all havе scars, I know it's hard
You're not alone, you're not alone
[Post-Chorus]
You're not alone, you're not alone

[Verse 2]
Started sweating bullets when her dad asked, "How d'you really feel?"
She said, "I've been feeling like something inside me wants to scream"
Won't call my friends, I'm persuaded that they'll leave in the end
Can't feel my legs, I'm feeling like a liar at best

[Chorus]
You're not alone like you think you are
You're not alone like you think you are
We all have scars, I know it's hard
You're not alone, you're not alone
You're not alone like you think you are
You're not alone like you think you are
We all have scars, I know it's hard
You're not alone, you're not alone

[Bridge]
I've often felt like I was born under a bad sign
Wearing suffering like a silk garment or a spot of blue ink
Looking for light and finding a hole where there shouldn't be one
I cannot communicate the depth of the feeling
Truth is I'm still learning to be open about this
But know that I know and you're not alone
Yeah, know that I know and you're not alone

songs.full_title: Hope (Live at the BRIT Awards 2021) by Arlo Parks
songs.title: Hope (Live at the BRIT Awards 2021)

annotations: Wearing suffering like a silk garment or a spot of blue ink

Parks presents two seperate ways of dealing with suffering:


Letting it become an extension of yourself like a silk garment, and being honest about it, as it is visible. A garment is easier to shed when necessary, too.
Hiding it away from plain sight like a stain of ink, and convincing yourself that it’s smaller than it actually is. It cannot be removed easily, instead lingering and causing grief.
Peckham Rye

Peckham Rye is a large park in South London.

Peckham Rye contains about 113 acres of open recreational grassland, ornamental and water gardens, a lake and woodland. Thus it is a common gathering spot, especially on sunny days.
